title: Brookings County Courthouse
text:
Brookings County Courthouse, located at the intersection of 4th St. and 6th Ave. in <a href="Brookings%2C%20South%20Dakota">Brookings</a>, is <a href="Brookings%20County%2C%20South%20Dakota">Brookings County</a>, <a href="South%20Dakota">South Dakota</a>'s <a href="county%20courthouse">county courthouse</a>. The courthouse was built in 1912 to replace the county's original courthouse, which was constructed in 1883. Architects <a href="C.%20E.%20Bell%2C%20Tyrie%20%26amp%3B%20Chapman">C. E. Bell, Tyrie & Chapman</a> designed the courthouse in the <a href="Renaissance%20Revival%20architecture">Renaissance Revival</a> style, which was common in early 20th century buildings. The J. B. Nelson Construction Company built the courthouse.
The courthouse was added to the <a href="National%20Register%20of%20Historic%20Places">National Register of Historic Places</a> on December 12, 1976. In 2011, the county began a $1 million renovation of the courthouse in order to meet the local circuit court's needs.
